tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE power_plants (
    plant_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    plant_name VARCHAR(255),
    location VARCHAR(255),
    capacity FLOAT,
    status VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE hydroelectric_power_plants (
 id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 plant_name VARCHAR(50),
 location VARCHAR(100),
 capacity DECIMAL(10,2)
);

CREATE TABLE electricity_generation (
 id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 plant_id INT,
 generation_date DATE,
 generation_time TIME,
 power_output DECIMAL(15,2),
 FOREIGN KEY (plant_id) REFERENCES hydroelectric_power_plants(id)
);

CREATE TABLE ElectricityGeneration (
    generation_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    plant_id INT,
    generation_time TIMESTAMP,
    generated_power DECIMAL(12,2),
    FOREIGN KEY (plant_id) REFERENCES HydroelectricPowerPlants(plant_id)
);

CREATE TABLE PowerPlants (
	power_plant_id INT,
	plant_name VARCHAR(50),
	location VARCHAR(100),
	capacity DECIMAL,
	commission_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE ElectricityProduction (
    production_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    plant_id INT,
    production_date DATE,
    production_amount FLOAT,
    FOREIGN KEY (plant_id) REFERENCES HydroelectricPowerPlants(plant_id)
);

CREATE TABLE PowerPlantMaintenance (
    maintenance_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    plant_id INT,
    maintenance_date DATE,
    maintenance_type VARCHAR(50),
    FOREIGN KEY (plant_id) REFERENCES HydroelectricPowerPlants(plant_id)
);

CREATE TABLE WeatherData (
    weather_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    date DATE,
    location VARCHAR(100),
    temperature FLOAT,
    humidity FLOAT
);
